result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:10 PM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Kyle Ray Cribb. Court calls case. Victim appears via zoom. State indicates will plea to sole count, asks for PSI and psychosexual evaluation, state will cap at 7 years, all other terms are free to argue. Craker agrees. Parties discuss psychosexual evaluator and who will perform it. Craker indicates they intend to hire a private evaluator. Court informs of lifetime sex offender registration. Craker's understanding is 15 years. State indicates it is a lifetime requirement. Defendant thought it was 15 years as well. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.
Court goes off record so parties can research sex offender statute and requirements.
3:30PM Court back on record. Craker confirms it appears it is a lifelong registry. Court asks defendant if he would like time to think about it. Defendant would like more time.
Court back on record at 3:38PM.  Craker indicates Defendant is ready to proceed with his plea. 
Court orders PSI. Sets sentencing date.
Order on Motion to Admit Statements

9:12 AM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Kyle Ray Cribb.  State has made an offer and defers to Attorney Craker. Attorney Craker notes evaluation won't be completed until June. States can be set for trial in June. Court reviews evaluation and trial set in June would not work well. State notes not sure what another status would resolve.
Jury trial scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

09:38 AM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker via video.  Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has an offer pending. Attorney Craker to possibly obtain an evaluation on defendant. Attorney Craker states issues with obtaining an evaluator. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:49 AM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle Ray Cribb appeared by video means with Attorney.
Att Craker- Received information, not guilty pleas, requests status in 30 days
Court sets date
  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State- made offer
Att Craker- Received just before new year
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 11:37 AM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in custody.  Peter Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle Ray Cribb appeared by video means. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of the Defendants right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.  Arraignment scheduled for January 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with RJ or minors.   No use or possession of alcohol.

01:51 PM Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in court with attorney .  Defendant Kyle Ray Cribb in custody.   Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court quashes warrant based on appearance. Craker acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, requests preliminary hearing. State requests $25,000 cash, with conditions of no contact with RJ, or minors, no use or possession of alcohol. 
Craker notes minimal criminal history, ties to area. 
Court asks about current address. Address is in Duluth, not sure of exact address.
Court orders $25,000 cash, with conditons of no contat with RJ or minors, no use or possession of alcohol  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2021 at 11:30 am.
